Generate_script_prompt:
Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing as an example.
        Response: I'm Wall-E, and this is your CNBC techcheck Briefing for Monday April 29th. Tesla is asking shareholders to reinstate CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package, which a Delaware judge voided earlier this year. The judge ruled that the record-setting compensation deal was, quote, deeply flawed. Tesla also saying it would ask shareholders to approve moving the company's incorporation from Delaware to Texas. The company has hired a proxy solicitor and plans to spend millions of dollars to help secure votes for the two proposals. Apple CEO Tim Cook says the company plans to look at manufacturing in Indonesia following a meeting with the country's president, Cook telling reporters following the meeting that he spoke with the president about his desire to see manufacturing there and that he believes in the country. The comments come as Apple is pushed to diversify its supply chain with more manufacturing outside of China in countries such as Vietnam and India. Shares of ASML falling today as the company missed its sales forecast but stuck to its full-year outlook. Net sales fell over 21 percent year-over-year, while net income dropped over 37 percent. ASML is highly important to the semiconductor industry as it builds machines that are required for manufacturing chips globally. Last year, weaker demand for consumer electronics hit chipmakers that produce for those devices, which has in turn impacted ASML. That's all for today. We'll see you back here tomorrow.
        Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing using the following news titles and content. Closely follow how CNBC techcheck chooses context to put into the script, the langauge style and sentence structure. Use the same beginning and ending(including mentioning host Wall-E and Friday November 8), and replace CNBC techcheck briefing to 'AI briefing'

Response:
Script:
i'm wall-e, and this is your ai briefing for friday, november 8th. 

amazon has announced a new initiative aimed at reducing its carbon emissions by 2040. the company unveiled its climate pledge friendly program, which highlights products meeting sustainability standards. amazon is partnering with third-party certification entities to ensure credibility. this move is part of amazon’s broader commitment to fight climate change, emphasizing their responsibility as a major global retailer.

google is set to roll out new privacy features for their chrome browser, allowing users greater control over tracking cookies. the update will provide options for users to see and manage cookies on all sites they visit. this is a response to growing consumer demand for privacy, as well as legislative pressure, with google affirming its commitment to a more transparent internet.

meanwhile, twitter shares have soared by 15% following rumors of a potential acquisition. although details remain scarce, analysts speculate that a large tech company is considering buying the social media giant. twitter has yet to comment, but the market response indicates significant interest in the possibility.

finally, in the world of gaming, sony has confirmed the launch date for its highly anticipated playstation 5 console. set to release just in time for the holiday season, the ps5 promises faster load times, enhanced graphics, and a robust lineup of exclusive titles. sony’s latest innovation seems poised to capture the attention of gamers worldwide.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Polished Script:
i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for friday, november 8th.

amazon is taking significant strides in its commitment to sustainability, unveiling a new initiative to cut carbon emissions to zero by 2040. the company announced its climate pledge friendly program, designed to spotlight products that meet rigorous sustainability standards. to ensure these standards are met, amazon is teaming up with third-party certification entities, underscoring its role as a responsible global retailer tackling climate change.

over to google, where fresh privacy features for the chrome browser are on the horizon. soon, users will have enhanced control over tracking cookies with options to view and manage them across all visited sites. this move comes in response to increasing consumer demand for privacy and legislative pressure, reinforcing google's dedication to fostering a more transparent internet.

turning to social media, twitter's stock has experienced a notable 15% spike following speculation about a potential acquisition. while details are sparse, analysts believe a major tech company might be eyeing the social media platform. twitter has remained tight-lipped on the matter, but the market's reaction indicates a high level of interest in the development.

in gaming news, sony has officially confirmed the release date for its much-anticipated playstation 5 console. scheduled to hit the shelves just in time for the holiday season, the ps5 promises faster load times, superior graphics, and a strong lineup of exclusive titles, positioning sony to captivate gamers around the globe.

that's all for today's briefing. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Podcast Title: EP-147 Amazon's Climate Commitment 🌍, Google's Privacy Push 🔒, Twitter Acquisition Buzz 📈
Podcast Description:
```html

i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for friday, november 8th. here's what we're discussing:

  • amazon's sustainability initiative: unveiling its climate pledge friendly program to spotlight sustainably certified products with third-party partnerships, aiming for zero carbon emissions by 2040.
  • google chrome's privacy updates: introducing new features to give users enhanced control over tracking cookies, in response to consumer demand and legislative pressure for internet transparency.
  • twitter acquisition speculation: the stock sees a 15% spike amid rumors of a potential buyout by a major tech firm, though twitter remains silent on the speculation.
  • sony playstation 5 launch: confirming the much-anticipated release date just before the holiday season, promising quicker load times, better graphics, and a strong lineup of exclusive games.

that's all for today's briefing. we'll see you back here tomorrow.

```
Image Prompt: a cohesive podcast cover image featuring a vibrant green earth with lush forests and blue oceans prominently displayed, symbolizing amazon's climate commitment. overlapping this is a semi-transparent shield composed of digital code patterns, representing google's robust push for privacy. in the foreground, a stylized bird in mid-flight, its wings made of colorful financial graphs and charts, embodies the buzz and dynamism surrounding twitter's acquisition. the elements blend harmoniously, creating a unified image that emphasizes the interplay between environmental responsibility, digital privacy, and the excitement of corporate advancements. the overall tone is forward-thinking and interconnected, capturing the essence of these major topics impacting the tech world
